Name: Funerary cone of Ibi
Description: The "funerary cones", which appeared from the 11th Dynasty onwards, particularly at Thebes, are in fact a special form of seals presenting at their base a short offering formula or more simply the titles and the name of the deceased. One does not only find them inside or near the tombs of the beneficiaries, but also in the sanctuaries where the offerings in favour of the gods were also reserved for the deceased. This example, which was part of the G. Hagemans collection, is in the name of the "great Chief Official of the divine adoratrice" Ibi, whose tomb is found in the necropolis of Assasif.
